meanings.definition: An electronic device with three electrodes used for amplification or switching.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully inserted the triode into the circuit board.
meanings.sent2: The triode is an essential component in many electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: Why did the triode refuse to amplify any signals? It wanted a break!
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a triode, amplifying ideas and switching between tasks effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The triode hummed softly, bringing life to the music playing through the speakers.

meanings.definition: A vacuum tube with three electrodes, typically used in radio and television equipment.
meanings.sent1: The old radio relied on a triode to pick up signals from afar.
meanings.sent2: In the early days of broadcasting, triodes were crucial for transmitting sound.
meanings.sent3: The triode in the TV tube cracked a joke, making the characters on screen laugh.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the room like a triode, filling every corner with sound.
meanings.sent5: The warm glow of the triode tube added a nostalgic touch to the vintage radio set.
